title: Intentional Feed botlane, can I afk?
body:
I'm support Janna.

Top lane says nothing INTs botlane all game from start.

ADC goes afk

I buy mobis walk around map / tab out to look at imgur for 15 minutes

I get afk ban, now I have to wait 20 minutes for game start.

Riot please explain what exactly you want me to do. The game was literally over from the start and I cant even open mid so I don't waste my time. Was I supposed to just sit in lane and farm as Janna, running away as soon as someone showed their face or else I die? I am being punished for some stupid fucks wasting my time and fucking up not only my rank, but my mmr.

and then just for shits and giggles you throw on an afk ban.


EDIT: I just checked the Garen's page and guess what, he's unranked and inting every game in his placements.

1/24/4
0/11/1
1/12/0
1/11/0
0/20/2
1/28/1
0/13/0
0/11/0
0/19/0
0/6/0

Finished placements silver 3

Before that? No games. How can your system not detect that, but instantly ban me for being afk maybe 3 minutes? AS WE WAITED TO LOSE THE 3V5

replies.body:
Because just because someone is being a twat and ruining your game, your supposed to sit there and take it.

It's a retarded system, where you have to put up with abuse/trolling/feeding/afking and just sit there and let it happen, say anything, you can get banned, afk, you get an afk penalty.

Well as long as all they did was int and ruin your game but they didnt swear at you, then you're clearly in the wrong
- Riot, 2017

Personally in ARAM I just go AFK if there are bots or someone quits the game, ****ed if I am going to keep wasting 20 minutes of my time trying to win when it's almost impossible.

If players on your team quit and don't come back after 5 minutes you should be able to exit without penalty and find another game.
Unfortunately, the way riots system is set up, you just have to stay silent and keep wasting your time to avoid punishment for the actions of others.
Because the int feeding ban bot, can only detect it when it's like 50+ games, when it's only 4 it doesn't matter it's ok.

I mean, if you look at any of the int feeder accounts, it takes upwards of 100's of games for them to actually be stopped.

The argument is basically "it could just be a bad day for them" when really that argument doesn't fly with the technology riot has that can detect where deaths were.... but why would we try and prevent intent feeding?
